active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Threat Intelligence and Hunting. Topic: Registry Run Keys Analysis (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Intelligence Types > 006_Indicators of Compromise (IoCs) > System and Registry IoCs > Registry Run Keys Analysis). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning components, scaffolding layers (4 progressive layers), and flashcard schema to generate high-quality, pedagogically optimized flashcards. Incorporate: - Prior knowledge: Builds on Windows Registry basics (HKLM/HKCU). - Completeness: Cover Run, RunOnce, legacy RunServices/RunServicesOnce paths; malicious examples (e.g., 'evil.exe', rundll32); hunting (PowerShell Get-ItemProperty, reg query, Autoruns); MITRE T1547.001; sources (MITRE, MS Docs, SANS). - Assessments: Embed MCQs, scenarios. - Balance Bloom's: Remember/Understand (Layer 1-2), Apply/Analyze (Layer 3), Evaluate/Create (Layer 4). Strictly follow the flashcard_generation_schema: Output ONLY a JSON array of 20-30 flashcards in the specified format. Ensure distractors are plausible per protocol. Make explanations concise yet educational, tying to active learning prompts where relevant (e.g., 'As in peer teaching activity...'). No additional text outside JSON.
